io

Class PlayerSaverLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.PlayerSaverLoader

  • public class PlayerSaverLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class created for loading, saving and deleting players. Since worlds are always the same, the only thing that needs to be saved is the player. This class can load, save and delete .player files from the file system. Each .player file contains the save date.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      private java.lang.String filePath

      private java.lang.String saveTime

      PlayerSaverLoader(java.lang.String playerFilePath, GameCreationMode loadOrCreate)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerSaverLoader

        public PlayerSaverLoader(java.lang.String playerFilePath,
                         GameCreationMode loadOrCreate)
                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Loads a saved Player with the given name from the file system.
        Parameters:
        playerFilePath - The name of the Player to load. Should match the save file name.
        loadOrCreate - whether the game should be loaded from a file or a new player file should be created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If an invalid Object was serialized in the save file.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the Stream.

    • Method Detail

      • deletePlayerFile

        public void deletePlayerFile()

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()

      • getSaveTime

        public java.lang.String getSaveTime()

      • loadPlayer

        private void loadPlayer()
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads a Player with the given name from a file and save the information within the class, which can later be accessed via the public getters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the Stream.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If an invalid Object was saved in the file.

      • now

        private java.lang.String now()
        Gets a String representation of the current time in MMM dd, YYYY HH:mm:ss format.
        Returns:
        A String representing the current time.

      • savePlayer

        public void savePlayer()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the already created Player, along with the save date, to the path provided upon construction. If the player file already exists, it will be overwritten.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the Stream.
